title: How to Make a Mushroom and Brussels Sprout Hash

steps.headline: Wash the mushrooms thoroughly under warm water to get rid of dirt.
steps.description: Dry them with a moist napkin. Peel the mushrooms instead of washing them if you prefer. Some say washing mushrooms makes them slimy.

steps.headline: Slice each mushroom into four pieces.
steps.description: If your using button mushrooms, as long as they are bite sized, they'll be fine. If using open cup mushrooms, cut them into bite sized bits. Set aside.

steps.headline: Wash the Brussels sprouts under warm water.
steps.description: Pull off any leaves that look unappetizing. Dry them using a moist napkin as with the mushrooms.

steps.headline: Turn the temperature on your stove top to medium.
steps.description: In a frying pan, heat the oil until it starts to sizzle. If you're not counting the calories, you can use butter.

steps.headline: Add your shallots in your pan.
steps.description: Have them cook for four minutes or until they are golden brown.

steps.headline: Add the mushrooms slowly, once the shallots are soft and brown.
steps.description: Add just a pinch of salt, and, some ground black pepper if liked.

steps.headline: Add the diced garlic when the mushrooms and sprouts are browned and cooked to your liking.
Cook for one more minute.
steps.description: After that, shut the stove off.

steps.headline: In another frying pan, fry an egg or two.
steps.description: Sprinkle on a pinch of pepper and salt.

steps.headline: Serve vegetable hash on a plate.

text: Wash the mushrooms thoroughly under warm water to get rid of dirt. Dry them with a moist napkin. Peel the mushrooms instead of washing them if you prefer. Some say washing mushrooms makes them slimy. Slice each mushroom into four pieces. If your using button mushrooms, as long as they are bite sized, they'll be fine. If using open cup mushrooms, cut them into bite sized bits. Set aside. Wash the Brussels sprouts under warm water. Pull off any leaves that look unappetizing. Dry them using a moist napkin as with the mushrooms. Cut into equal pieces. Set aside. Turn the temperature on your stove top to medium. In a frying pan, heat the oil until it starts to sizzle. If you're not counting the calories, you can use butter. Add your shallots in your pan. Have them cook for four minutes or until they are golden brown. Add the mushrooms slowly, once the shallots are soft and brown. Add just a pinch of salt, and, some ground black pepper if liked. Add the chopped Brussel sprouts.  Add the diced garlic when the mushrooms and sprouts are browned and cooked to your liking.  Cook for one more minute. After that, shut the stove off. In another frying pan, fry an egg or two. Sprinkle on a pinch of pepper and salt. Serve vegetable hash on a plate. Place fried egg on top.
